intro: Ivesia callida, commonly known as the narrowleaf ivesia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and other shrubs. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, giving it a distinctive appearance in its native habitat.
